text:
Hi everyone…
I am very new to Julia and trying to use Plots. It is almost three days that I ran into a problem whenever I run `using Plots` in any environment possible (vscode, Atom, jupyter, julia from terminal). running this, I receive an error like this:
ERROR: LoadError: LoadError: InitError: could not load library `"/Users/mahdimirhosseini/.julia/artifacts/34970354470efa0ab8a80c455d13a16caec8cc7c/lib/libass.9.dylib"`
`dlopen(/Users/mahdimirhosseini/.julia/artifacts/34970354470efa0ab8a80c455d13a16caec8cc7c/lib/libass.9.dylib, 1): image not found`

`ERROR: LoadError: Failed to precompile FFMPEG_jll [b22a6f82-2f65-5046-a5b2-351ab43fb4e5] to /Users/mahdimirhosseini/.julia/compiled/v1.5/FFMPEG_jll/uSD0T_SQjTE.ji.`

`ERROR: LoadError: Failed to precompile FFMPEG [c87230d0-a227-11e9-1b43-d7ebe4e7570a] to /Users/mahdimirhosseini/.julia/compiled/v1.5/FFMPEG/TGvga_SQjTE.ji.`

`ERROR: Failed to precompile Plots [91a5bcdd-55d7-5caf-9e0b-520d859cae80] to /Users/mahdimirhosseini/.julia/compiled/v1.5/Plots/ld3vC_SQjTE.ji.`

all errors has some stacktrace that are ignored…

What i did up to now are:
reinstalling julia,
remove and reinstalling all packages,
build FFMPEG,
and almost anything I found in the web similar to my error.
my system is mac pro and I am using Big Sur 11.2.2.
I had my machine restarted several times and also did PRAM as well…

I have posted in the helpdesk group as well few days ago and couldn’t figure out how to solve this problem.

Any suggestion is greatly appreciated.

text: When you say you tried removing and reinstalling all packages, did you try deleting the `.julia` folder?

elements.text: When you say you tried removing and reinstalling all packages, did you try deleting the

text: I have no idea what is causing this but maybe that will help

elements.text: I have no idea what is causing this but maybe that will help

text: also have you looked at <https://github.com/JuliaPlots/Plots.jl/issues/2638|this issue>?

yes… I removed .julia and also deleted all packages using Pkg.rm… I also used Pkg.GC()

haven’t tried to rename .jluia, though.
